trans-unit.source: Operations Manager considerations with Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: Operations Manager considerations with Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: If you use Microsoft Azure Operational Insights with Operations Manager, then your configuration relies on a distribution of Operations Manager agents and management groups to collect and send data to the Operational Insights service for analysis
trans-unit.target: If you use Microsoft Azure Operational Insights with Operations Manager, then your configuration relies on a distribution of Operations Manager agents and management groups to collect and send data to the Operational Insights service for analysis

trans-unit.source: Operations Manager considerations with Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: Operations Manager considerations with Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: If you use Microsoft Azure Operational Insights with Operations Manager, then your configuration relies on a distribution of Operations Manager agents and management groups to collect and send data to the Operational Insights service for analysis.
trans-unit.target: If you use Microsoft Azure Operational Insights with Operations Manager, then your configuration relies on a distribution of Operations Manager agents and management groups to collect and send data to the Operational Insights service for analysis.

trans-unit.source: However, if you use agents that connect directly to the web service, then you do not need Operations Manager.
trans-unit.target: However, if you use agents that connect directly to the web service, then you do not need Operations Manager.

trans-unit.source: Consider the following issues when your use Operational Insights with Operations Manager.
trans-unit.target: Consider the following issues when your use Operational Insights with Operations Manager.

trans-unit.source: Also, you'll need to specify the Run-As credentials for the workloads monitored my Operations Manager to Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: Also, you'll need to specify the Run-As credentials for the workloads monitored my Operations Manager to Operational Insights.

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights software functions and requirements
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights software functions and requirements

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights consists of a web service in the cloud, and either agents that connect directly to the web service or Operations Manager agents and Operations Manager management groups that are managing computers in your environment.
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights consists of a web service in the cloud, and either agents that connect directly to the web service or Operations Manager agents and Operations Manager management groups that are managing computers in your environment.

trans-unit.source: Before you select Operations Manager agents (to collect data) and management groups (to manage agents and send data to the Operational Insights service), ensure that you understand the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you select Operations Manager agents (to collect data) and management groups (to manage agents and send data to the Operational Insights service), ensure that you understand the following:

trans-unit.source: The Operations Manager agent is installed on any server from which you want to collect and analyze data.
trans-unit.target: The Operations Manager agent is installed on any server from which you want to collect and analyze data.

trans-unit.source: The Operations Manager management group transfers data from agents to the Operational Insights web service.
trans-unit.target: The Operations Manager management group transfers data from agents to the Operational Insights web service.

trans-unit.source: It does not analyze any of the data.
trans-unit.target: It does not analyze any of the data.

trans-unit.source: The Operations Manager management group must have access to the Internet to upload data to the web service.
trans-unit.target: The Operations Manager management group must have access to the Internet to upload data to the web service.

trans-unit.source: For the best results, do not install the Operations Manager management server on a computer that is also a domain controller.
trans-unit.target: For the best results, do not install the Operations Manager management server on a computer that is also a domain controller.

trans-unit.source: An Operations Manager agent must have network connectivity to the Operations Manager management group so it can transfer data.
trans-unit.target: An Operations Manager agent must have network connectivity to the Operations Manager management group so it can transfer data.

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights can use the System Center Health Service to collect and analyze data.
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights can use the System Center Health Service to collect and analyze data.

trans-unit.source: Operations Manager depends on the System Center Health Service.
trans-unit.target: Operations Manager depends on the System Center Health Service.

trans-unit.source: When you view the programs that are installed on your server, you will see System Center Operations Manager agent software, particularly in Add/Remove Programs.
trans-unit.target: When you view the programs that are installed on your server, you will see System Center Operations Manager agent software, particularly in Add/Remove Programs.

trans-unit.source: Do not remove these because Operational Insights is dependent on them.
trans-unit.target: Do not remove these because Operational Insights is dependent on them.

trans-unit.source: If you remove the Operations Manager agent software, Operational Insights will no longer function.
trans-unit.target: If you remove the Operations Manager agent software, Operational Insights will no longer function.

trans-unit.source: Coexistence with Operations Manager
trans-unit.target: Coexistence with Operations Manager

trans-unit.source: When using Operations Manager, Operational Insights is only supported with the Operations Manager agent in System Center Operations Manager 2012 R2 or System Center Operations Manager 2012 SP1.
trans-unit.target: When using Operations Manager, Operational Insights is only supported with the Operations Manager agent in System Center Operations Manager 2012 R2 or System Center Operations Manager 2012 SP1.

trans-unit.source: It is not supported with previous versions of System Center Operations Manager.
trans-unit.target: It is not supported with previous versions of System Center Operations Manager.

trans-unit.source: Because the Operations Manager agent is used to collect data, it uses specific credentials (action accounts or Run As accounts) to support some of the analyzed workloads, such as SharePoint 2012.
trans-unit.target: Because the Operations Manager agent is used to collect data, it uses specific credentials (action accounts or Run As accounts) to support some of the analyzed workloads, such as SharePoint 2012.

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights and SQL Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights and SQL Server 2012

trans-unit.source: When using Operations Manager, the System Center Health Service runs under the Local System account.
trans-unit.target: When using Operations Manager, the System Center Health Service runs under the Local System account.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server versions earlier than SQL Server 2008 R2, the Local System account was enabled by default and was a member of the system administrator server role.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server versions earlier than SQL Server 2008 R2, the Local System account was enabled by default and was a member of the system administrator server role.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Server 2012, the Local System login is not part of the system administrator server role.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Server 2012, the Local System login is not part of the system administrator server role.

trans-unit.source: As a result, when you use Operational Insights, it cannot monitor the SQL Server 2012 instance completely, and not all rules can generate alerts.
trans-unit.target: As a result, when you use Operational Insights, it cannot monitor the SQL Server 2012 instance completely, and not all rules can generate alerts.

trans-unit.source: Internet and internal network connectivity
trans-unit.target: Internet and internal network connectivity

trans-unit.source: When using agents that connect directly with the web service, the agents need to access the Internet to send data to the web service and to receive updated configuration information from the web service.
trans-unit.target: When using agents that connect directly with the web service, the agents need to access the Internet to send data to the web service and to receive updated configuration information from the web service.

trans-unit.source: When using Operations Manager, management server needs to access the Internet to send data to the web service and to receive updated configuration information from the web service.
trans-unit.target: When using Operations Manager, management server needs to access the Internet to send data to the web service and to receive updated configuration information from the web service.

trans-unit.source: However, your agents do not need to access the Internet.
trans-unit.target: However, your agents do not need to access the Internet.

trans-unit.source: If you have Operations Manager agents on servers that are not connected to the Internet, you can use the web service if they can communicate with an Internet-connected management server.
trans-unit.target: If you have Operations Manager agents on servers that are not connected to the Internet, you can use the web service if they can communicate with an Internet-connected management server.

trans-unit.source: Clustering support
trans-unit.target: Clustering support

trans-unit.source: The Operations Manager agent is supported on computers running Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2008 that is configured to be part of a Windows failover cluster.
trans-unit.target: The Operations Manager agent is supported on computers running Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2008 that is configured to be part of a Windows failover cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can view the clusters in the Operational Insights portal.
trans-unit.target: You can view the clusters in the Operational Insights portal.

trans-unit.source: On the Servers page, clusters are identified as TYPE=CLUSTER (as opposed to TYPE=AGENT, which is how physical computers are identified).
trans-unit.target: On the Servers page, clusters are identified as TYPE=CLUSTER (as opposed to TYPE=AGENT, which is how physical computers are identified).

trans-unit.source: The discovery and configuration rules run on the active and passive nodes of the cluster, but any alerts generated on the passive nodes are ignored.
trans-unit.target: The discovery and configuration rules run on the active and passive nodes of the cluster, but any alerts generated on the passive nodes are ignored.

trans-unit.source: If a node shifts from passive to active, alerts for that node are displayed automatically, with no intervention required from you.
trans-unit.target: If a node shifts from passive to active, alerts for that node are displayed automatically, with no intervention required from you.

trans-unit.source: Some alerts might be generated twice, depending on the rule that generates the alert.
trans-unit.target: Some alerts might be generated twice, depending on the rule that generates the alert.

trans-unit.source: For example, a rule that detects a bad driver by examining the operating system generates alerts for the physical server and for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: For example, a rule that detects a bad driver by examining the operating system generates alerts for the physical server and for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Configuration analysis of passive nodes is not supported.
trans-unit.target: Configuration analysis of passive nodes is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights does not support grouping or linking computers running Windows Server that are part of the same failover cluster.
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights does not support grouping or linking computers running Windows Server that are part of the same failover cluster.

trans-unit.source: Scaling your Operational Insights environment
trans-unit.target: Scaling your Operational Insights environment

trans-unit.source: When you plan your Operational Insights deployment (particularly when you analyze the number of Operations Manager agents that you want to transfer data through a single management group), consider the capacity of that server in terms of file space.
trans-unit.target: When you plan your Operational Insights deployment (particularly when you analyze the number of Operations Manager agents that you want to transfer data through a single management group), consider the capacity of that server in terms of file space.

trans-unit.source: Consider the following variables:
trans-unit.target: Consider the following variables:

trans-unit.source: Number of agents per management group
trans-unit.target: Number of agents per management group

trans-unit.source: The average size of the data transferred from the agent to the management group per day.
trans-unit.target: The average size of the data transferred from the agent to the management group per day.

trans-unit.source: By default, each agent uploads CAB files to the management group twice per day.
trans-unit.target: By default, each agent uploads CAB files to the management group twice per day.

trans-unit.source: The size of the CAB files depends on the configuration of the server (such as number of SQL Server engines and number databases) and the health of the server (such as the number of alerts generated).
trans-unit.target: The size of the CAB files depends on the configuration of the server (such as number of SQL Server engines and number databases) and the health of the server (such as the number of alerts generated).

trans-unit.source: In most cases, the daily upload size is typically less than 100 KB.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, the daily upload size is typically less than 100 KB.

trans-unit.source: Archival period for keeping data in the management group (the default is 5 days)
trans-unit.target: Archival period for keeping data in the management group (the default is 5 days)

trans-unit.source: As an example, if you assume a daily upload size of 100 KB per agent and the default archival period, you would need the following storage for the management group:
trans-unit.target: As an example, if you assume a daily upload size of 100 KB per agent and the default archival period, you would need the following storage for the management group:

trans-unit.source: Number of agents
trans-unit.target: Number of agents

trans-unit.source: Estimated space required for the management group
trans-unit.target: Estimated space required for the management group

trans-unit.source: ~2.5 MB (5 agents x 100 KB data/day x 5 days = 2,500 KB)
trans-unit.target: ~2.5 MB (5 agents x 100 KB data/day x 5 days = 2,500 KB)

trans-unit.source: ~25 MB (50 agents x 100 KB data/day x 5 days = 25,000 KB)
trans-unit.target: ~25 MB (50 agents x 100 KB data/day x 5 days = 25,000 KB)

trans-unit.source: Operations Manager run-as accounts for Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: Operations Manager run-as accounts for Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights uses the Operations Manager agent and management group to collect and send data to the Operational Insights service.
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights uses the Operations Manager agent and management group to collect and send data to the Operational Insights service.

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights builds upon management packs for workloads to provide value-add services.
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights builds upon management packs for workloads to provide value-add services.

trans-unit.source: Each workload requires workload-specific privileges to run management packs in a different security context, such as a domain account.
trans-unit.target: Each workload requires workload-specific privileges to run management packs in a different security context, such as a domain account.

trans-unit.source: You need to provide credential information by configuring an Operations Manager Run As account.
trans-unit.target: You need to provide credential information by configuring an Operations Manager Run As account.

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe how to set Operations Manager run-as accounts for the following workloads:
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe how to set Operations Manager run-as accounts for the following workloads:

trans-unit.source: SQL Assessment
trans-unit.target: SQL Assessment

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machine Manager
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machine Manager

trans-unit.source: Lync Server
trans-unit.target: Lync Server

trans-unit.source: SharePoint
trans-unit.target: SharePoint

trans-unit.source: Set the Run As account for SQL assessment
trans-unit.target: Set the Run As account for SQL assessment

trans-unit.source: If you are already using the SQL Server management pack, you should use that Run As account.
trans-unit.target: If you are already using the SQL Server management pack, you should use that Run As account.

trans-unit.source: To configure the SQL Run As account in the Operations console
trans-unit.target: To configure the SQL Run As account in the Operations console

trans-unit.source: In Operations Manager, open the Operations console, and then click **Administration**.
trans-unit.target: In Operations Manager, open the Operations console, and then click **Administration**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Run As Configuration**, click **Profiles**, and open **Operational Insights SQL Assessment Run As Profile**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Run As Configuration**, click **Profiles**, and open **Operational Insights SQL Assessment Run As Profile**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Run As Accounts** page, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Run As Accounts** page, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Select a Windows Run As account that contains the credentials needed for SQL Server, or click **New** to create one.
trans-unit.target: Select a Windows Run As account that contains the credentials needed for SQL Server, or click **New** to create one.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Run As account type must be Windows.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Run As account type must be Windows.

trans-unit.source: The Run As account must also be part of Local Administrators group on all Windows Servers hosting SQL Server Instances.
trans-unit.target: The Run As account must also be part of Local Administrators group on all Windows Servers hosting SQL Server Instances.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Modify and then execute the following T-SQL sample on each SQL Server Instance to grant minimum permissions required to Run As Account to perform SQL Assessment.
trans-unit.target: Modify and then execute the following T-SQL sample on each SQL Server Instance to grant minimum permissions required to Run As Account to perform SQL Assessment.

trans-unit.source: However, you don’t need to do this if a Run As Account is already part of the sysadmin server role on SQL Server Instances.
trans-unit.target: However, you don’t need to do this if a Run As Account is already part of the sysadmin server role on SQL Server Instances.

trans-unit.target: To configure the SQL Run As account using Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Open a PowerShell window and run the following script after you’ve updated it with your information:
trans-unit.target: Open a PowerShell window and run the following script after you’ve updated it with your information:

trans-unit.source: Set the Run As account for Virtual Machine Manager
trans-unit.target: Set the Run As account for Virtual Machine Manager

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the Run As account has privileges for the following actions:
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the Run As account has privileges for the following actions:

trans-unit.source: To use the VMM Windows PowerShell module
trans-unit.target: To use the VMM Windows PowerShell module

trans-unit.source: To query the VMM database
trans-unit.target: To query the VMM database

trans-unit.source: To remotely administer the VMM agents running on virtualization hosts
trans-unit.target: To remotely administer the VMM agents running on virtualization hosts

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to set the account when you connect Operational Insights to Operations Manager.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to set the account when you connect Operational Insights to Operations Manager.

trans-unit.source: To set credentials for VMM
trans-unit.target: To set credentials for VMM

trans-unit.source: In Operations Manager, open the Operations console, and then click **Administration**.
trans-unit.target: In Operations Manager, open the Operations console, and then click **Administration**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Run As Configuration**, click **Profiles**, and open **Operational Insights VMM Run As Account**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Run As Configuration**, click **Profiles**, and open **Operational Insights VMM Run As Account**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Run As Accounts** page, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Run As Accounts** page, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Select a Windows Run As account that contains the credentials needed for VMM, or click **New** to create one.
trans-unit.target: Select a Windows Run As account that contains the credentials needed for VMM, or click **New** to create one.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Run As account type must be Windows.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Run As account type must be Windows.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Set the Run As account for Lync Server
trans-unit.target: Set the Run As account for Lync Server

trans-unit.source: The Run As account needs to be a member of both the local Administrators and the Lync RTCUniversalUserAdmins security groups.
trans-unit.target: The Run As account needs to be a member of both the local Administrators and the Lync RTCUniversalUserAdmins security groups.

trans-unit.source: To set credentials for a Lync account
trans-unit.target: To set credentials for a Lync account

trans-unit.source: In Operations Manager, open the Operations console, and then click **Administration**.
trans-unit.target: In Operations Manager, open the Operations console, and then click **Administration**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Run As Configuration**, click **Profiles**, and open **Operational Insights Lync Run As Account**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Run As Configuration**, click **Profiles**, and open **Operational Insights Lync Run As Account**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Run As Accounts** page, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Run As Accounts** page, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Select a Windows Run As account that is a member of both the Local Administrators and the Lync RTCUniversalUserAdmins security groups.
trans-unit.target: Select a Windows Run As account that is a member of both the Local Administrators and the Lync RTCUniversalUserAdmins security groups.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Run As account type must be Windows.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Run As account type must be Windows.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Set the Run As account for SharePoint
trans-unit.target: Set the Run As account for SharePoint

trans-unit.source: To set credentials for a SharePoint account
trans-unit.target: To set credentials for a SharePoint account

trans-unit.source: In Operations Manager, open the Operations console, and then click **Administration**.
trans-unit.target: In Operations Manager, open the Operations console, and then click **Administration**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Run As Configuration**, click **Profiles**, and open **Operational Insights SharePoint Run As Account**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Run As Configuration**, click **Profiles**, and open **Operational Insights SharePoint Run As Account**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Run As Accounts** page, click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Run As Accounts** page, click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: Select a Windows Run As account that contains the credentials needed for SharePoint, or click **New** to create one.
trans-unit.target: Select a Windows Run As account that contains the credentials needed for SharePoint, or click **New** to create one.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The Run As account type must be Windows.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The Run As account type must be Windows.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Geographic locations
trans-unit.target: Geographic locations

trans-unit.source: If you want to analyze data from servers in diverse geographic locations, consider having one management group per location.
trans-unit.target: If you want to analyze data from servers in diverse geographic locations, consider having one management group per location.

trans-unit.source: This can improve the performance of data transfer from the agent to the management group.
trans-unit.target: This can improve the performance of data transfer from the agent to the management group.
